definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Agency officials say the country's weak drug laws are compounding the problem.
sentences.chinese: 该机构官员说，该国薄弱的禁毒法使问题复杂化。

sentences.english: Gardens in Japan, though of Chinese parentage, have more conventions and less complexity in lay-out than the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 日本园林，虽然源于中国，布局的习俗化大于复杂化。

sentences.english: Its use will complicate Army airspace command and control.
sentences.chinese: 它的使用将会使陆军的空域指挥与控制复杂化。

sentences.english: He always likes to complicate simple matters.
sentences.chinese: 他总喜欢把简单的事情复杂化。

sentences.english: But that may complicate TARP's objective of jumpstarting lending.
sentences.chinese: 但这可能会让TARP重启贷款的目标更加复杂化。

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: The milk scandal is already complicating international trade, with the discovery of contaminated products.
sentences.chinese: 奶品丑闻已经令国际贸易复杂化。

sentences.english: The leader's departure thickens the proBlems. Our apprehension thickened.
sentences.chinese: 领导者的离去使问题复杂化。

sentences.english: The unpredictability of the recovery is complicating decisions that governments must consider.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的不可预测性令政府必须考虑的决策复杂化。

sentences.english: A further complication involves diagnosing in a clustered environment.
sentences.chinese: 在集群环境中，诊断会进一步复杂化。

sentences.english: Developing knowledge of increasingly complex syntactic structures.
sentences.chinese: 增加逐渐复杂化的句法结构知识。

sentences.english: Mencius based on this carries on the filial piety thought the display, causes its complication.
sentences.chinese: 孟子在此基础上把孝道思想进行发挥，使其复杂化。

sentences.english: Mark's interference merely ravelled things further.
sentences.chinese: 马克的掺和只是让情况进一步复杂化了。

sentences.english: For that reason I think the increasing sophistication of these games is to be welcomed.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我认为那些日益复杂化的游戏应该受到欢迎。

sentences.english: You did not need to overcomplicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 你没有必要把事情复杂化了。

definition: to come to the surface/to become apparent
to intensify/to become acute/to come to a head
to publicize/openness (of government, PRC equivalent of "glasnost")
